name: Road density and proximity to channel
functionStatement: Quantity + quality of inflow (tributaries, ditches, and pipes) does not provide harmful peaks or pollution, and supports diverse habitat conditions.
descriptionMarkdown: Tributaries stable, matching reference (flow, quality, form), with no major flash/pollution surges.
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Watershed and Channel

Method: Desktop
howToMeasureMarkdown: Compute road density within the watershed and, where possible, compute road length within a riparian buffer along the reach to capture proximity.

inputs.label: Road density and proximity to channel

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: <0.5 km roads per km2, with few roads close to the channel.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: 0.5-1.0 km per km2, or limited road proximity to the channel.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: 1-2 km per km2, or roads commonly adjacent to the channel.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: >2 km per km2, or frequent road proximity with clear runoff and sediment delivery risk.
